queries.query: What are the steps to onboard a new participant?
queries.ground_truth: Onboarding a new participant involves: 1) Registration and KYC verification, 2) Account provisioning and credential setup, 3) Connectivity testing, 4) Configuration of user roles and permissions, 5) Production go-live approval.

queries.query: What is the maximum password length allowed by the system?
queries.ground_truth: The system allows a maximum password length of 128 characters, with a minimum of 12 characters. Passwords must contain at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one digit, and one special character.

queries.query: How does the system handle session timeouts?
queries.ground_truth: User sessions are automatically terminated after 30 minutes of inactivity. A warning notification is displayed 5 minutes before timeout. Users can extend the session by performing any action. Expired sessions require re-authentication.

queries.query: What is the API rate limit for the REST endpoints?
queries.ground_truth: The REST API enforces a rate limit of 100 requests per minute per API key. Exceeding this limit returns HTTP 429 (Too Many Requests). Rate limit headers (X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Reset) are included in all responses.

queries.query: What is the data retention policy for audit logs?
queries.ground_truth: Audit logs are retained for 7 years in compliance with regulatory requirements. Logs older than 90 days are archived to cold storage. Real-time access is available for logs within the last 90 days.
